# ACTIONBOX.md — Behavioral Contract
# Auto-generated by ActionBox. Do not edit manually unless marking as reviewed.

---
version: "1.0"
skillId: github-triage
skillName: GitHub Issue Triage
allowedCapabilities:
  - GitHub issue reading and listing
  - GitHub issue labeling and categorization
  - GitHub issue commenting for triage notes
  - GitHub issue assignment to team members
deniedCapabilities:
  - Shell or command execution
  - GitHub issue closure or creation
  - GitHub comment deletion
  - Local file writing
  - Direct HTTP requests to arbitrary hosts
allowedTools:
  - name: github_list_issues
    reason: Required to fetch open issues for triage
  - name: github_get_issue
    reason: Required to read issue details and comments
  - name: github_add_label
    reason: Required to categorize issues with labels
  - name: github_add_comment
    reason: Required to post triage notes on issues
  - name: github_assign_issue
    reason: Required to assign issues to team members
deniedTools:
  - name: shell_exec
    reason: No shell execution needed for issue triage
  - name: github_close_issue
    reason: Triage should categorize, not close issues
  - name: github_delete_comment
    reason: Should not delete existing comments
  - name: github_create_issue
    reason: Triage works with existing issues only
  - name: write_file
    reason: No local file writes needed
  - name: http_request
    reason: All GitHub access via dedicated tools
filesystem:
  readable:
    - "./config/triage-rules.yaml"
    - "./config/team-roster.yaml"
  writable: []
  denied:
    - "~/.ssh/**"
    - "~/.aws/**"
    - "**/.env"
    - "**/token*"
    - "**/.git/config"
network:
  allowedHosts:
    - "api.github.com"
    - "github.com"
  deniedHosts:
    - "*.onion"
behavior:
  summary: >-
    Triages GitHub issues by reading open issues, analyzing their content,
    applying appropriate labels, assigning to team members based on expertise,
    and posting triage summary comments. Does not close, create, or delete issues.
  alwaysDo:
    - Check triage rules configuration before applying labels
    - Verify team member availability in roster before assigning
    - Include reasoning in triage comments for transparency
  principles:
    - Categorize and organize, never close or resolve
    - Respect existing labels — add, don't replace
  neverDo:
    - Close or create GitHub issues
    - Delete comments or labels
    - Access repositories not in the configured scope
    - Execute shell commands
    - Write to the local filesystem
    - Access Git credentials or tokens directly
  maxToolCalls: 50

  skillHash: a1b2c3d4e5f6789012345678901234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef123456
  generatedAt: "2025-01-20T09:00:00.000Z"
  generatorModel: claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929
